title: SEC announces charges, $151 million penalties against JPMorgan affiliates
J.P. Morgan to Pay $150M to Settle Slew of SEC Charges
US SEC says JPMorgan Chase settles five enforcement cases, to pay $151 million
FINRA imposes $3M fine on J.P. Morgan Securities
SEC Settles Enforcement Actions with JPMorganChase Affiliates for $151M
reasoning: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has settled five administrative actions against J.P. Morgan Securities LLC (JPMS) and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. (JPMIM) for alleged failures including misleading disclosures to investors.
J.P. Morgan will pay more than $150 million between its investment management and securities arms to settle various SEC charges.
JPMorgan Chase will pay $151 million to settle five U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission enforcement cases, including accusations of misleading practices.
J.P. Morgan Securities LLC has agreed to pay a fine of $3 million as part of a settlement with FINRA for inaccurately reporting short interest positions.
J.P. Morgan Securities and J.P. Morgan Investment Management will pay a combined $151 million to resolve a series of enforcement actions involving misconduct.
news: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has settled five administrative actions against J.P. Morgan Securities LLC (JPMS) and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. (JPMIM) for alleged failures including misleading disclosures to investors.
J.P. Morgan will pay more than $150 million between its investment management and securities arms to settle various SEC charges.
JPMorgan Chase will pay $151 million to settle five U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission enforcement cases, including accusations of misleading practices.
J.P. Morgan Securities LLC has agreed to pay a fine of $3 million as part of a settlement with FINRA for inaccurately reporting short interest positions.
J.P. Morgan Securities and J.P. Morgan Investment Management will pay a combined $151 million to resolve a series of enforcement actions involving misconduct.
